free_text.Learning outcomes: PhD students will learn [br/](i) the fundamental basis and principles of Statistical Mechanics[br/](ii) its relationship to Thermodynamics[br/](iii) useful theorems and results[br/](iii) physics of thermo-mechanical properties of materials[br/](iv) basis of molecular simulation techniques[br/]
free_text.Content: Underlying Principles of Statistical Mechanics[br/]     Review of Classical Dynamics        [br/]     Probability, Accessible States, and the meaning of Entropy[br/]     Connection to Thermodynamics and Thermodynamic Ensembles[br/]     Boltzmann distribution; Partition Function [br/]     Free Energy [br/]     Equipartition and Viral Theorems[br/]     Fluctuations and the Fluctuation-Dissipation Theorem[br/] [br/]Applications[br/]     Illustrative examples for non-interacting systems[br/]     Thermoelastic Properties of a Solids[br/]     Vibrations and Elastic Moduli [br/]     Heat Capacity [br/]     Phonons[br/]     Basics of the theory of Liquids[br/]     Molecular Dynamics simulations and Thermostats[br/]     Transition State Theory[br/]     Monte Carlo Simulations [br/]     Other topics per class interests[br/][br/]
